task.title: How to add layer masks
task.shortdesc: In this section you will learn about layer masks and how to integrate them in your design.

prereq.p: Before you begin you need an open project in Procreate with at least 1 added layer.

context.p: Layer masks allow you to selectively modify the opacity (transparency) of the layer they belong to. They are especially useful when you need to selectively modify the opacity of different areas across a single layer.

step.cmd: Swipe right-to-left on your layer of choice to open the menu.

result.p: Your layer mask will appear above the selected layer.

example.p: Erasing or painting in black hides parts of the parent layer, and painting in white reveals parts. Varying shades of gray alter the content with corresponding levels of opacity.
